result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Ygnacio Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Traffic/Ordinance Violation, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(2)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to any other probation.  If probation becomes revoked, the defendant is to receive sentence credit of 1 day.

miscConds.notes: Court orders the $500 cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: With huber and concurrent to the sentence in 2014CF140 and consecutive to any other sentence.  Sentence is to commence immediately.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Aaron Ygnacio Hernandez
Current: PO Box 2200, C/O Racine Youthful Offender Correctional Facility, Racine, WI 53404-0001 United States  (Effective: 03-29-2017)
Prior: 430 E. Division St, C/O Waushara County Jail, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States

1:14 p.m.  Defendant incustody present in court with Atty Jeffrey Mann and Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites plea agreement, defendant will plea to count 1 amended to misdemeanor Escape in violation of 946.42(2)(a) and count 2 with no enhancer on 2014CF 81 and count 2 & count 3 amended to Misdemeanor jumping; all other counts will be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Atty Mann concurs.  Defendant concurs.  State moves to amend the 2 counts.  Court grants the amendments.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as amended and count 2 with no enhancer on 2014CF81 and count 2 and count 3 as amended on 2014CF140.  Court orders all other counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Selsing.  Sentencing statement by Atty Mann.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

(EACH CASE/COUNT) SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent to any other probation.

CONDITIONS:

2014CF140 - Ct 1 - 60 days county jail, with huber
2014CF81 - Ct 1 - 60 days county jail, with huber - concurrent to each other and consecutive to any other sentence.
Court costs.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit of 14 days on 14CF140 if revoked.  
Court grants the defendant sentence credit of 1 day on 14CF81 if revoked.

Sentences to commence immediately.

Court adjourned at 1:32 p.m.
Waushara County Jail - 08/17/2015 at 12:30 p.m. (Plea & Sentencing)
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-17-2015 01:00 pm

Statement by the Court - mail was sent to the defendant to the Waushara County Jail and the notice of hearing was returned.  Statement by Atty Mann - defendant is now back in the Waushara County Jail on a probation hold.  Statement by Atty Selsing.  Court will set for plea & sentencing on August 17, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  Writ to be done for Waushara County.

Court adjourned at 9:02 a.m.

Cross exam by Atty Mann.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Mann and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Mann enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

1:52 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin. Court instructs defendant regarding his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing in approx 30 days.
